intro: Primula spectabilis f. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered primrose, is a cultivar of the primrose family (Primulaceae) characterized by its solitary, showy flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with lance-shaped, dark green leaves and a compact growth habit. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in early spring and are borne on short, sturdy stems. This variety is relatively hardy and thrives in cool, moist environments with partial shade.
